definition-item.definition-title: PHOTOMECHANICAL PRODUCTION OF TEXTURED OR PATTERNED SURFACES, e.g. FOR PRINTING, FOR PROCESSING OF SEMICONDUCTOR DEVICES; MATERIALS THEREFOR; ORIGINALS THEREFOR; APPARATUS SPECIALLY ADAPTED THEREFOR; (phototypographic composing devices B41B; photosensitive materials or processes for photographic purposes G03C; electrophotography, sensitive layers or processes therefor G03G)

section-body.paragraph-text: Photolithographic materials, processing these materials for producing textured or patterned surfaces, and apparatus for processing these materials.

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus or arrangements for taking, projecting or viewing photographs
Photosensitive materials or processes for photographic purposes
Electrophotography, sensitive layers or processes thereof
Reproduction of pictures or patterns by scanning and converting into electrical signals

section-body.paragraph-text: The following IPC groups are not used in the internal ECLA classification system. Subject-matter covered by these groups is classified in the following ECLA groups:
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sensitive to electromagnetic radiation but also to corpuscular radiation
Photosensitive substances, e.g. quinonediazides, and, if applicable, binders or additives
Photosensitive compositions, e.g. photoresists, the bases carrying them and, if applicable, auxiliary layers

definition-item.definition-title: Originals for photomechanical production of textured or patterned surfaces, e.g., masks, photo-masks, reticles; Mask blanks or pellicles therefor; Containers specially adapted therefor; Preparation thereof

section-body.paragraph-text: Products modifying the pattern of radiation being transmitted through or reflected by said products (e.g. masks, photomasks, reticles), substrates therefor, auxiliary features (e.g. pellicles or auxiliary structures), process for their preparation, control and repair, containers for storage and/or transport of said products.

table-column.paragraph-text: Masking layers which are integral part of a photosensitive element and photosensitive as such
Masking layers which are integral part of a photosensitive element provided they are not photosensitive as such
Addressable masks, e.g. transmissive liquid crystal arrays or micromirror devices
Aperture plates for light beam shaping, e.g. diaphragms
Holographic devices to modify light pattern
Shaping beams in charged particle lithography

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Normally involves (de)magnification - the terms mask and reticle are however often considered synonyms.
Protective cover placed at a distance from the surface of a reticle.
Electromagnetic radiation in the 5-15 nm range (typically 13.4 nm)
Scattering with angular limitation in projection electron beam lithography (characterized by the use of a membrane mask rather than a stencil mask)
Attenuated phase-shifting mask, aka half-tone PSM
Alternating phase-shifting mask, aka Levenson-Shibuya mask
No absorber between phase shifting areas

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: Colour separation; Correction of tonal value (photographic copying apparatus in general G03B)

section-body.paragraph-text: Non numerical rendition of colours; non numerical colour proofing.

table-column.paragraph-text: Producing decorative effects (e.g. by transfer pictures, decalcomanias, by pressing or stamping ornemental designs on surfaces)
General purpose image data processing (e.g. numerical colour conversion)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Duplicating or marking methods; sheet materials for use therein

definition-item.definition-title: Screening processes; Screens therefor {(plates or light sensitive layers with incorporated screen G03F7/004)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Creation of half-tone patterns from continuous tone images using photolithographic / photomechanical processes.

table-column.paragraph-text: Plates or light sensitive layers with incorporated screen
Screen printers, printing screens and processes in general
Photolith films, i.e. high contrast AgX photographic materials
Digital treatment of continuous tone images in order to transform them into half-tone patterns

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Photomechanical, e.g. photolithographic, production of textured or patterned surfaces, e.g. printing surfaces; Materials therefor, e.g. comprising photoresists; Apparatus specially adapted therefor (using photoresist structures for special production processes, see the relevant places, e.g. B44C, H01L, e.g. H01L21/00, H05K)

section-body.paragraph-text: Photolithographic production of textured or patterned surfaces, e.g. printing surfaces; materials therefor, e.g. comprising photoresists; apparatus specially adapted therefor (using photoresist structures for special production processes, see the relevant places, e.g. B44C, H01L, e.g. H01L21/00, H05K); imprint lithography.

table-column.paragraph-text: Structuring a surface by laser beam
Printing plate preparation (e.g. by laser ingraving)
Duplicating or marking methods; Sheet materials for use therein (e.g. inkjet printing, ablative recording, thermography)
Preparing for use and conserving printing surfaces (e.g. chemical or electrical treatment of aluminum support)
Producing decorative effects (e.g. by transfer pictures, decalcomanias, by pressing or stamping ornemental designs on surfaces)
Investigating or analyzing materials by use of optical means (e.g. pattern inspection)
Photosensitive materials for photographic purposes (mainly silver halide containing system)
Holographic processes and apparatus using light
General purpose image data processing (e.g. numerical colour conversion)
Process or apparatus adapted for the manufacture or treatment of semiconductors (except for coating, exposure and development of photoresist)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lithographic printing form preparation using heat
Printing form preparation by laser ingraving
Polymerization processes using a photoinitiator system
Addition polymers or copolymers, ethylenic monomers
Condensation polymers of aldehydes or ketones with phenols only, e.g. novolak resins

Homopolymers or copolymers of compounds having one or more unsaturated aliphatic radicals, each having only one carbon-to-carbon double bond, and only one being terminated by only one carboxyl radical, or of salts, anhydrides, esters, amides, imides or nitriles thereof
Recording or reproducing by optical means, by modifying optical properties or the physical structure (holographic medium, optical disks, compact disks or CD, digital versatile disks or DVD)
Cathode ray tubes, electron or ion beam tubes

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: (1) Printing: Lithography in which the image is photographically transferred to the printing surface; esp. a planographic printing process using plates prepared from photographic negatives, usually printed by offset methods. (2) Electronics: A photoetching process in which a photomask is used in transferring the pattern to the photoresist, used esp. in the making of integrated circuits.
Energy radiated in the form of electromagnetic waves or particles
Radiation-sensitive material, whose solubility is altered by exposure to radiation.
The resist film beneath the clear areas of the photomask undergoes a chemical change that renders it insoluble in the developing solution.
The resist film beneath the clear areas of the photomask undergoes a chemical change that renders it soluble in the developing solution.
A technique that creates patterns by mechanical deformation of imprint resist and subsequent processes.

special-meanings.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Planographic printing plate or offset printing plate

definition-item.definition-title: {Lithographic processes using patterning methods other than those involving the exposure to radiation, e.g. by stamping}

section-body.paragraph-text: Micro- and nanostructuring of surfaces based on transfer printing and imprinting processes, specially adapted as alternatives for photolithographic processes. It also includes use of cantilevers for depositing, mechanically removing or displacing material for the same purpose.

table-column.paragraph-text: Patterning of substrates with cantilevers, based on electrically induced processes
Handling of individual nanostructures, atoms or molecular structures using cantilevers
Embossing processes for optical data carriers (CD, DVD)
Cantilevers or micropoint sources in e-beam lithography

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Printing processes for forming pattern structures of organic semiconductive material

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Deposition from cantilever using fluid transfer

definition-item.definition-title: {Filters, e.g. additive colour filters; Components for display devices}

section-body.paragraph-text: Radiation-sensitive compositions for colour filters, black matrix, etc, and processes
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Phase modulating patterns, e.g. refractive index patterns}

section-body.paragraph-text: Radiation-sensitive compositions for holographic applications, and processes.

table-column.paragraph-text: Holographic processes and apparatus using light
Recording or reproducing by optical means, by modifying optical properties or the physical structure (holographic medium, optical disks, compact disks or CD, digital versatile disks or DVD)

definition-item.definition-title: {Production of three-dimensional images}

section-body.paragraph-text: Radiation-sensitive compositions for stereolithographic applications and processes.

definition-item.definition-title: Photosensitive materials (G03F7/12, G03F7/14 take precedence)

table-column.paragraph-text: Production of screen printing forms or similar printing forms, e.g. stencils

definition-item.definition-title: {providing an etching agent upon exposure (G03F7/075 takes precedence; photolytic halogen compounds G03F7/0295)}
{with inorganic or organometallic light-sensitive compounds not otherwise provided for, e.g. inorganic resists (G03F7/075 takes precedence)}
{Chalcogenides; Silicon, germanium, arsenic or derivatives thereof; Metals, oxides or alloys thereof (G03F7/0044 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: e.g. use of metal alkoxide compounds (sol-gel technology) in photosensitive materials.

table-column.paragraph-text: Organometallic compounds involving an interaction between the metallic and non-metallic component, e.g. photodope systems

definition-item.definition-title: {with organic non-macromolecular light-sensitive compounds not otherwise provided for, e.g. dissolution inhibitors}

section-body.paragraph-text: Photoacid generating compounds, photobase generating compounds; acid diffusion inhibiting compounds (i.e. quencher).

definition-item.definition-title: {with perfluoro compounds, e.g. for dry lithography (G03F7/0048 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Radiation-sensitive compositions containing fluorine-containing compounds in general

table-column.paragraph-text: Photosensitive materials characterized by the solvents or agents facilitating spreading, e.g. surfactants

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by additives for obtaining a metallic or ceramic pattern, e.g. by firing}

section-body.paragraph-text: Radiation-sensitive compositions containing inorganic microparticles as additives.

definition-item.definition-title: Azides (G03F7/075 takes precedence)
Macromolecular azides; Macromolecular additives, e.g. binders {(G03F7/0085 takes precedence)}

table-column.paragraph-text: Non-macromolecular azides characterized by the non-macromolecular additives

definition-item.definition-title: Diazonium salts or compounds (G03F7/075 takes precedence)
Macromolecular diazonium compounds; Macromolecular additives, e.g. binders {(G03F7/0166 takes precedence)}

table-column.paragraph-text: Non-macromolecular diazonium salts characterised by the non-macromolecular additive

definition-item.definition-title: Quinonediazides (G03F7/075 takes precedence)
Macromolecular quinonediazides; Macromolecular additives, e.g. binders {(G03F7/0226 takes precedence)}

table-column.paragraph-text: Quinonediazides characterised by the non-macromolecular additives

definition-item.definition-title: {Condensation products of carbonyl compounds and phenolic compounds, e.g. novolak resins}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Condensation polymers of aldehydes or ketones with phenols only, e.g. novolak resins

definition-item.definition-title: Non-macromolecular photopolymerisable compounds having carbon-to-carbon triple bonds, e.g. acetylenic compounds (G03F7/075 takes precedence)
Non-macromolecular photopolymerisable compounds having carbon-to-carbon double bonds, e.g. ethylenic compounds (G03F7/075 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: Radiation-sensitive composition containing an addition polymerizable monomer having at least one ethylenically unsaturated double bond such as an acrylate or a methacrylate compound
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Macromolecular compounds obtained by reactions involving carbon-to carbon unsaturated bonds

definition-item.definition-title: Inorganic compounds; Onium compounds; Organic compounds having hetero atoms other than oxygen, nitrogen or sulfur

section-body.paragraph-text: Inorganic photoinitiators or photosensitizers; Photoinitiators or photosensitizers containing other elements than carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, nitrogen and sulfur
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Polymerization processes using a photoinitiator system

definition-item.definition-title: Organic compounds not covered by group G03F7/029

section-body.paragraph-text: Photoinitiators or photosensitizers containing the following elements only: carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, nitrogen and sulfur.

table-column.paragraph-text: Organic compound having hetero atoms other than oxygen, nitrogen or sulfur

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Polymerization processes using a photoinitiator system

definition-item.definition-title: the binders being polymers obtained by reactions only involving carbon-to-carbon unsaturated bonds, e.g. vinyl polymers

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Compositions of homopolymers or copolymers of compounds having one or more unsaturated aliphatic radicals, each having only one carbon-to-carbon double bond, and only one being terminated by only one carboxyl radical, or of salts, anhydrides, esters, amides, imides or nitriles thereof

definition-item.definition-title: the binders being polyurethanes

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: the binders being polyamides or polyimides

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Macromolecular compounds which are rendered insoluble or differentially wettable (G03F7/075 takes precedence; macromolecular azides G03F7/012; macromolecular diazonium compounds G03F7/021)

section-body.paragraph-text: Macromolecular photopolymerizable compounds; Non-macromolecular crosslinkable epoxy compounds are also classified in this subgroup.

table-column.paragraph-text: The macromolecular compound being present in a chemically amplified negative photoresist composition

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {using epoxidised novolak resin}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Polyamides or polyimides}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Macromolecular compounds which are photodegradable, e.g. positive electron resists (G03F7/075 takes precedence; macromolecular quinonediazides G03F7/023)

table-column.paragraph-text: The macromolecular compound being present in a chemically amplified positive photoresist composition

definition-item.definition-title: Chromates (G03F7/075 takes precedence)
Silver salts (G03F7/075 takes precedence)
used for diffusion transfer {(G03F7/063 takes precedence)}

table-column.paragraph-text: Additives in silver salts systems; additives or means to improve the lithographic properties; processing solutions characterised by such additives; treatment after development or transfer, e.g. finishing, washing; correction or deletion fluids

definition-item.definition-title: {Non-macromolecular compounds containing silicon-to-silicon bonds (G03F7/0752 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Macromolecular compounds containing silicon-to-silicon bonds are also classified in this subgroup.

table-column.paragraph-text: Silicon-containing compounds in non photosensitive layers or as additives

definition-item.definition-title: {Non-macromolecular compounds containing Si-O, Si-C or Si-N bonds (G03F7/0752 takes precedence)}

table-column.paragraph-text: Silicon-containing compounds in non photosensitive layers or as additives

definition-item.definition-title: {Macromolecular compounds containing Si-O, Si-C or Si-N bonds (G03F7/0752 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Polymerized siloxanes or polysiloxanes (silicones), polysilazanes, etc.

table-column.paragraph-text: Silicon-containing compounds in non photosensitive layers or as additives

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Photosensitive compositions characterised by adhesion-promoting non-macromolecular additives (G03F7/075 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: Adhesion-promoting macromolecular additives are also classified in this subgroup

table-column.paragraph-text: Silicon-containing compounds used as adhesion-promoting additives

definition-item.definition-title: characterised by structural details, e.g. supports, auxiliary layers (supports for printing plates in general B41N)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Supports for printing plates in general

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by antireflection means or light filtering or absorbing means, e.g. anti-halation, contrast enhancement}

section-body.paragraph-text: Antireflective compositions for bottom antireflective coating, top antireflective coating, etc.

definition-item.definition-title: having more than one photosensitive layer (G03F7/075 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: Versatile radiation-sensitive compositions (i.e. positive-negative tone) are also classified in this subgroup.

definition-item.definition-title: having cover layers or intermediate layers, e.g. subbing layers {(G03F7/091 - G03F7/093, B41N3/03 take precedence)}

table-column.paragraph-text: Preparing for use and conserving printing surfaces

definition-item.definition-title: Coating processes; Apparatus therefor (applying coatings to base materials in general B05; applying photosensitive compositions to base for photographic purposes G03C1/74)

section-body.paragraph-text: Processes for coating a substrate. Specific treatments of the substrate before coating are also classified in this subgroup.

table-column.paragraph-text: Applying coatings to base materials in general
Preparing for use and conserving printing surfaces
Applying photosensitive compositions to base for photographic purposes

definition-item.definition-title: {from the gas phase, by plasma deposition (G03F7/2035 takes precedence)}
{Finishing the coated layer, e.g. drying, baking, soaking}

section-body.paragraph-text: Edge bead removal is also classified in this subgroup.

definition-item.definition-title: Exposure; Apparatus therefor (photographic printing apparatus for making copies G03B27/00)

table-column.paragraph-text: Photographic printing apparatus for making copies

definition-item.definition-title: {in the presence of a fluid, e.g. immersion; using fluid cooling means}

section-body.paragraph-text: Radiation-sensitive composition for immersion lithography, fluids used in immersion lithography.

definition-item.definition-title: {using a cantilever}

section-body.paragraph-text: e.g. Atomic force microscopy, scanning tunnel exposure techniques.

definition-item.definition-title: {Exposure without an original mask, e.g. using a programmed deflection of a point source, by scanning, by drawing with a light beam, using an addressed light or corpuscular source (G03F7/70 takes precedence)}
{using a laser (ablative removal B41C)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Multiphoton lithography is classified in this subgroup

definition-item.definition-title: Exposing with the same light pattern different positions of the same surface at the same time {(G03F7/70 takes precedence)}
Exposing sequentially with the same light pattern different positions of the same surface {(G03F7/70 takes precedence)}
Curved surfaces {(G03F7/70 takes precedence)}
Processing photosensitive materials; Apparatus therefor (G03F7/12 - G03F7/24 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: Various techniques of purification of radiation-sensitive materials are also classified in this subgroup.

definition-item.definition-title: {Selective reaction with inorganic or organometallic reagents after image-wise exposure, e.g. silylation}

section-body.paragraph-text: Selective reaction with a reagent taking place before development. Selective reactions with organic reagents are also classified in this subgroup.

definition-item.definition-title: for obtaining powder images (G03F3/10 takes precedence)

table-column.paragraph-text: Checking the colour or tonal value of separation negatives or positives, using tonable photoresist or photopolymerizable systems

definition-item.definition-title: {from printing plates fixed on a cylinder or on a curved surface; from printing cylinders}

section-body.paragraph-text: On press development is also included in this subgroup.

definition-item.definition-title: Liquid compositions therefor, e.g. developers

table-column.paragraph-text: Gumming or finishing solutions for printing plates

definition-item.definition-title: Imagewise removal not covered by groups G03F7/30 - G03F7/34, e.g. using gas streams, using plasma

section-body.paragraph-text: e.g. thermal development, development using gas streams, using plasma, photoembossing.

table-column.paragraph-text: Imagewise removal by selective transfer, e.g. peeling away

definition-item.definition-title: Treatment before imagewise removal, e.g. prebaking {(G03F7/265 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Treatments such as post exposure bake

table-column.paragraph-text: Selective reaction with organic, inorganic or organometallic reagents before imagewise removal

definition-item.definition-title: Treatment after imagewise removal, e.g. baking

section-body.paragraph-text: Treatments such as post-development bake, thermal flow, pattern profile improvement.

definition-item.definition-title: {Treatment with inorganic or organometallic reagents after imagewise removal}

section-body.paragraph-text: Treatments with organic reagents after imagewise removal are also classified in this subgroup.

definition-item.definition-title: Stripping or agents therefor

section-body.paragraph-text: Stripping involving the use of a combination of means, e.g. plasma and radiation.

definition-item.definition-title: {using liquids only (G03F7/421 takes precedence)}

table-column.paragraph-text: Using biological means only, e.g. enzymes

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {containing mineral acids or salts thereof, containing mineral oxidizing substances, e.g. peroxy compounds}

section-body.paragraph-text: Stripping agents containing organic oxidizing substances are also classified in this subgroup.

definition-item.definition-title: {containing organic halogen compounds; containing organic sulfonic acids or salts thereof; containing sulfoxides}

section-body.paragraph-text: Stripping agents containing carboxylic acids or salts thereof are also classified in this subgroup.

definition-item.definition-title: {using plasma means only}

section-body.paragraph-text: Stripping treatments using plasma, gas or supercritical fluids.

definition-item.definition-title: Registration or positioning of originals, masks, frames, photographic sheets or textured or patterned surfaces, e.g. automatically (G03F7/22 takes precedence; preparation of photographic masks G03F1/00; within photographic printing apparatus for making copies G03B27/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: Positioning and alignment of originals, i.e. mask or reticle with the target substrate to be exposed by actinic radiation. Positioning and alignment of a radiation beam with respect to the target in direct-write lithographic processes. Alignment marks on mask and target. Devices for carrying out the positioning and alignment.

table-column.paragraph-text: Positioning in the preparation of photographic masks
Positioning in exposing sequentially with the same light pattern different positions of the same surface
Positioning within photographic printing apparatus for making copies
Positioning ion beams for patterning purposes
Overlay of successive layers in a multilayer patterned semiconductor or solid state device

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Detection of the position of an object on a substrate

definition-item.definition-title: {for microlithography (measuring printed patterns for monitoring overlay G03F7/70633 or focus G03F7/70641; projection system adjustment G03F7/70258; position control G03F7/70775)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Aligning an original with a workpiece in a lithographic apparatus. Alignment marks for originals or workpieces. Devices for carrying out the aligning.

table-column.paragraph-text: Illumination system adjustment, alignment during assembly of illumination system and regular adjustment
Beam registration in direct write photolithography
Projection system adjustment, alignment during assembly of projection system and regular adjustment
Measuring printed patterns for overlay control
Measuring printed patterns for focus control
Positioning device and position control in a lithographic apparatus
Alignment of original or workpiece in charged particle beam lithography

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lithographic processes using patterning methods other than those involving exposure to radiation, e.g. by imprinting or transfer printing

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: micro- and nanoprojection, proximity or contact photolithography; micro- and nanoimprint or transfer printing lithography
e.g. reticle, photomask, addressable mask, imprint mold, stamp
target substrate to be patterned via lithography
includes aligning in the substrate plane (i.e. aligning as such) and perpendicularly to the substrate plane (i.e. focussing or gap setting)
